results.title: Technically speaking - career futures for women
results.brief_description: Shows girls working in technical occupations. Indicates the range of jobs available, the prerequisites, work conditions, and attitudes by employers and fellow workers to girls in these jobs. Also shows how parents and teachers have discouraged girls from taking up these occupations.

results.title: Why study insects?
results.brief_description: Focuses on the work undertaken by Australian National Insect Collection in Canberra where insects from all parts of Australia are studied. Explains why it is important to understand the behaviour of insects. The production does not provide descriptions of insects, rather the processing of information.

results.title: Tale of two cities
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Charles Dickens’ immortal tale of romance and intrigue set against the lurid background of the French Revolution. Dirk Bogarde stars as Sydney Carlton whose final act of self-sacrifice brings the story to its dramatic end. Also stars Dorothy Tutin and Cecil Parker, Leo McKern, Christopher Lee and Donald Pleasence.

results.title: Speaking of Harvey
results.creator_credit: Eric Friedl and Pyramid Film and Video
results.brief_description: Considers the issue of animal experimentation in the world of science, as seen through the eyes of a young research scientist working with the liver physiology of de-arterialized livers. He raises he issues of vivisections rather clearly and tries to persuade us that we can carry out these experiments “Humanly”. Raises issues surrounding animal experimentation.

results.title: Running high: a story of pain and joy ...
results.creator_credit: Gus Howard and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Novices and champions prepare for, and run the 1983 Festival City Marathon. Robert de Castella intersperses candid interviews with his marathon running philosophy and techniques. Discusses the exhilaration of personal improvement, the disappointment of hitting the wall and the reasons behind the increasing popularity of running throughout the world.

results.title: Eager to write: Lorraine Wilson
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Dicusses the ways in which children learn to write and how children who find writing difficult can be encouraged and taught. Features many of the ideas of Lorraine Wilson.

results.title: Sweet sixteen and pregnant
results.creator_credit: John Cosgrove, Ann Hassett and Dave Bell Associates
results.brief_description: Provides case studies of teeage pregnancies looking at the outcome for each girl when it was discovered that she was pregnant. Considers adoption, abortion, keeping the child, and living with one’s family. Highlights the enormous stress of being a teenage mother and points out that girls should fight peer group pressure to have sexual relationships if they do not wish to do so.
